author: My Storm Heroes
title: Tired of dealing with insurance? Let My Storm Heroes rescue your home from storm damage | Paid Content | weareiowa.com
text: [Storm Heroes](https://mystormheroes.com/) is a 2 person team of Storm Damage experts with a combined 15 years of experience identifying storm damage, and helping their customers navigate confusing property insurance claims. A few key things they would like to help people understand are: how to identify signs that you may need to call someone to inspect your home for damage, and the importance of finding a contractor that you trust that has experience working with storm damage claims to team up with your insurance company to help make sure you get fully indemnified and your property restored. Storm damage can be difficult to identify if it is not something you are used to looking for. Many homeowners have no idea they have damage at all. Just a few simple signs you can look for after a storm comes through your area are: a lot of leaves or branches on the ground, knocked out of trees by wind or hail, dents on the metals of your home that you can see from ground level, holes in your vinyl siding, or the "cleaned off" white marks called spatter, on your sidewalk or deck. If you see these or anything else that see that seems suspicious, you should call your trusted storm damage contractor. Storm Heroes will provide a comprehensive analysis of your property for absolutely free. Your storm damage contractor will fully inspect your property to insure all damage is identified, and help the adjuster find it all during the adjuster inspection as well. They will work hard to provide all the evidence necessary, during each step of the process, and help overcome the obstacles that will surely come during a property claim. A few things you should look for when choosing a storm damage contractor to work with are: - Knowledge and experience specific to the storm damage industry and dealing with insurance claims. This is a very confusing, ever-changing industry that requires constantly being up to date on best practices. - Do you trust them and feel they are working with integrity and your best interests in mind and will they help you with every aspect of your claim for your benefit? - Will they be there helping you throughout the entirety of your claim until the end, and will they be around in case you need them in the future? - Do they have some references of the quality of service they provide that they are willing to share with you? Contact Storm Heroes now for a trustworthy, committed team ready to help with your storm damage claim.

author: Nancy West
title: InDepthNH Wins 2024 Nonprofit News Award, Featuring Ani Freedman Reporting
text: [InDepthNH.org ](https://indepthnh.org)won a Nonprofit News Award called an INNY Wednesday night at the awards ceremony at the National Center for Civil and Human Rights in Atlanta. The award honors an Institute for Nonprofit News member organization that made a significant contribution to the well-being of its community through a journalism-centered project or service. The award judges singled out Ani Freedman in the Community Champion micro-division for her investigative reporting regarding â€œforever chemicalsâ€ in Merrimack. Freedman has a masterâ€™s degree in journalism from Columbia University and lived in Nashua while reporting for InDepthNH.org. â€œI am beyond grateful to have been honored with this award from the Institute for Nonprofit News. To the people of Merrimack who entrusted me with their stories and came along for the journey of PFAS accountability amid environmental and health injustice, I thank you deeply. I could not have done it without you. And thank you, Nancy West and everyone at InDepthNH for believing in me, supporting me, and simply giving me a chance. â€œCurrently Iâ€™m a fellow for Fortune Magazine doing health and wellness reporting,â€ Freedman said. West congratulated Freedman saying, â€œInDepthNH.org is thrilled for you, Ani, and grateful for all the work you did on so many different issues, especially forever chemicals, while reporting for us in New Hampshire, and your representation of InDepthNH.org at Institute for Nonprofit News Days in San Diego. â€œThe New Hampshire Press Association was 100 percent correct naming you â€˜Rookie of the Yearâ€™ when you were getting started here. It is wonderful that talented people like you have chosen journalism at a time when we need more hard-working, honest and ethical reporters in the field. Reporters like you, Ani. We hope you will return to InDepthNH.org someday. In the meantime, we will be following your reporting for Fortune at [https://fortune.com/author/ani-freedman](https://fortune.com/author/ani-freedman),â€ West said. The judges praised Freedman for investigating the impact of â€˜forever chemicals polluting groundwater, soil and surface water in Merrimack and their ties to Saint-Gobain Performance Plastics. â€œThat sort of reporting is not easy, one judge said. The science can be hard to explain. Corporations responsible for the pollution wonâ€™t talk or tell the truth. And, itâ€™s essential to tell the personal stories of impact, to humanize the issue,â€ the judge wrote. â€œBut, Ani Freedman does a good job getting to the bottom of this complex story. Itâ€™s a good example of the kind of accountability journalism that gets lost when newspapers shutter and the kind of reporting that nonprofit news organizations can do to enable residents to tell their stories and speak truth to power.â€ The Nonprofit News Awards (or INNYs) honor excellence in journalism, leadership and community service across the field of nonprofit news. In 2024, the Institute for Nonprofit News received 626 entries â€” the largest so far, and gave out 29 awards across 11 categories. A total of 75 judges, including nationally recognized journalists from across the INN Network and many other news organizations, formed panels to evaluate the entries. Read the Winning Work [Saint-Gobainâ€™s Controversial Air Permit Approved by NHDES](https://indepthnh.org/2023/08/17/saint-gobains-controversial-air-permit-approved-by-nhdes/) [State Rep: Saint-Gobain Leaves, But Health Impacts of PFAS Are Here to Stay](https://indepthnh.org/2023/08/29/state-rep-saint-gobain-leaves-but-health-impacts-of-pfas-are-here-to-stay/) [Saint-Gobain Denies NHDES Requests for More Sampling of PFAS-Contaminated Sites](https://indepthnh.org/2024/04/26/saint-gobain-denies-nhdes-requests-for-additional-sampling-of-pfas-contaminated-sites/)

organizations.name: National Center for Civil and Human Right

author: @indiatoday
title: Dense fog warning issued in Delhi, 4 other north Indian states till December 31
text:
11 trains delayed as dense fog engulfs North India, no relief until December 31
As many as 11 trains have been delayed as dense fog continued across the north Indian states on Friday. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has, however, predicted no respite from the conditions until December 31 morning.
Listen to Story
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast dense to very dense fog to continue across north Indian states till December 30.
Cold day conditions have also been predicted to remain in parts of Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana and Chandigarh, according to the IMD bulletin.
The Met Department stated that fog conditions would begin improving from December 31 morning onwards.
These dense fog conditions have heavily impacted transport services,
hitting flights and train operations that have been marred by multiple cancellations and delays. According to the latest updates by the Northern Railways, as many as 11 trains have been delayed due to dense fog in the north Indian states.
Amid icy cold conditions, schools remain closed in Gautam Buddh Nagar - consisting of Noida and Greater Noida. The district administration ordered closure of schools for students for December 29 and 30. However, teachers and other staffers would work.
The IMD, meanwhile, predicted the minimum temperature to hover around seven to eight degrees Celsius over the next five days. On Thursday, the national capital's minimum temperature settled at 8.4 degrees Celsius, one notch above the season's average, while the maximum temperature was recorded at 21.4 degrees Celsius, also one notch above normal.
Visuals on social media showed people sleeping inside shelter homes in Delhi. A video shared by news agency ANI showed visibility almost completely reduced at Thursday midnight in areas around the Indira Gandhi International Airport.
Conditions have, however, improved significantly now. Visibility at Delhi Airport was at 150 metres, with runways at a range of 400 metres to 800 metres, at the time of writing this report.
Meanwhile, at least six people were killed, and 12 others were injured in two separate road accidents in Uttar Pradesh due to reduced visibility on Thursday, police told news agency PTI. Earlier in the day, at least four people were killed and six injured in
separate road crashes in Uttar Pradesh due to reduced visibility from dense fog.
In an advisory for dense fog, the Met department has asked drivers to use fog lights and travellers to stay updated on schedules of airlines, railways and state transport. "Exercise caution while driving or using any mode of transportation," the IMD said.

author: Caroline Vale
title: Este medicamento popular pode ser arriscado para quem tem mais de 65 anos
text:
O paracetamol, amplamente utilizado para aliviar dores e reduzir febres, Ã© geralmente considerado seguro.
A pesquisa analisou dados de pacientes idosos que fizeram uso repetido de paracetamol - iStock/SVPhilon No entanto, um estudo recente da Universidade de Nottingham, na Inglaterra, e publicado na revista Arthritis Care and Research , indica que seu uso prolongado pode apresentar riscos significativos para pessoas com 65 anos ou mais.
Quais sÃ£o os riscos do uso prolongado de paracetamol em idosos? A pesquisa analisou dados de 180.483 pacientes idosos que fizeram uso repetido de paracetamol (duas ou mais prescriÃ§Ãµes em seis meses) e identificou uma associaÃ§Ã£o com o aumento de:
Ãºlceras peptÃ­dicas; insuficiÃªncia cardÃ­aca; hipertensÃ£o; doenÃ§a renal crÃ´nica. Devido Ã  sua reputaÃ§Ã£o de seguranÃ§a, o paracetamol tem sido amplamente recomendado como tratamento de primeira linha para condiÃ§Ãµes como a osteoartrite, especialmente em idosos que apresentam maior risco de complicaÃ§Ãµes relacionadas a medicamentos.
Weiya Zhang, lÃ­der do estudo, ressalta que, embora sejam necessÃ¡rias mais pesquisas para confirmar essas descobertas, Ã© crucial reconsiderar o uso do paracetamol.

EntÃ£o entre no canal da Catraca Livre no WhatsApp e fique atualizado! âœ… â€œDado seu efeito mÃ­nimo de alÃ­vio da dor, o uso de paracetamol como analgÃ©sico de primeira linha para condiÃ§Ãµes de longo prazo, como osteoartrite em idosos, precisa ser cuidadosamente consideradoâ€, afirmou.
RecomendaÃ§Ãµes para o uso de paracetamol em idosos Ã‰ fundamental que o uso de paracetamol por idosos seja supervisionado por profissionais de saÃºde. A Anvisa alerta que o uso indiscriminado do medicamento pode levar a eventos adversos graves, incluindo hepatite medicamentosa e morte.
Portanto, Ã© essencial seguir as doses recomendadas e considerar alternativas quando apropriado.
Existem outras opÃ§Ãµes de analgÃ©sicos que podem ser consideradas, dependendo da condiÃ§Ã£o especÃ­fica e do perfil de saÃºde do paciente. Consulte seu mÃ©dico.
A Catraca Livre tambÃ©m divulgou um estudo que sugere que certos medicamentos podem elevar o risco de demÃªncia, clique aqui para entender essas descobertas .

author: Larissa Silva
title: Tenha um lindo jardim vertical na sua casa com essas dicas
text:
A jardinagem vertical Ã© uma tÃ©cnica inovadora que permite o cultivo de plantas em superfÃ­cies verticais, como paredes e estruturas especialmente projetadas. Essa abordagem Ã© ideal para ambientes urbanos onde o espaÃ§o horizontal Ã© limitado, transformando paredes em verdadeiros jardins. A jardinagem vertical nÃ£o apenas maximiza o uso do espaÃ§o, mas tambÃ©m contribui para a estÃ©tica e a sustentabilidade dos ambientes.
Com o aumento da urbanizaÃ§Ã£o, a jardinagem vertical surge como uma soluÃ§Ã£o prÃ¡tica para aqueles que desejam incorporar a natureza em suas vidas diÃ¡rias. AlÃ©m de proporcionar um toque de verde, essa tÃ©cnica ajuda a melhorar a qualidade do ar e a reduzir a temperatura em Ã¡reas urbanas, criando microclimas mais agradÃ¡veis.
Como criar um jardim vertical?
Para iniciar um jardim vertical, Ã© fundamental escolher o tipo de estrutura que melhor se adapta ao seu espaÃ§o e Ã s suas necessidades. Existem vÃ¡rias opÃ§Ãµes, desde treliÃ§as e painÃ©is de madeira atÃ© sistemas modulares de plÃ¡stico ou cerÃ¢mica. A escolha da estrutura deve considerar o peso das plantas e a facilidade de instalaÃ§Ã£o e manutenÃ§Ã£o.
ApÃ³s escolher a estrutura, Ã© importante instalar um sistema de irrigaÃ§Ã£o eficiente, como o gotejamento, que garante que todas as plantas recebam a quantidade adequada de Ã¡gua. O substrato utilizado deve ser leve e rico em nutrientes para sustentar o crescimento saudÃ¡vel das plantas. O plantio deve respeitar o espaÃ§amento adequado entre as espÃ©cies para evitar competiÃ§Ã£o por luz e nutrientes.
Quais sÃ£o os benefÃ­cios da jardinagem vertical?
A jardinagem vertical oferece uma sÃ©rie de benefÃ­cios que vÃ£o alÃ©m da estÃ©tica. Um dos principais Ã© a melhoria da qualidade do ar, jÃ¡ que as plantas ajudam a filtrar poluentes e aumentar os nÃ­veis de oxigÃªnio. AlÃ©m disso, os jardins verticais atuam como isolantes tÃ©rmicos, reduzindo a necessidade de ar-condicionado e aquecimento, o que pode resultar em economia de energia.
Outro benefÃ­cio significativo Ã© a contribuiÃ§Ã£o para a biodiversidade. Jardins verticais podem atrair polinizadores, como abelhas e borboletas, e atÃ© mesmo pequenos pÃ¡ssaros, promovendo um ecossistema saudÃ¡vel em Ã¡reas urbanas. AlÃ©m disso, eles oferecem uma oportunidade Ãºnica para o cultivo de alimentos em espaÃ§os reduzidos, permitindo que ervas e vegetais frescos estejam sempre Ã  mÃ£o.
Quais sÃ£o as desvantagens da jardinagem vertical?
Apesar dos muitos benefÃ­cios, a jardinagem vertical tambÃ©m apresenta alguns desafios. A manutenÃ§Ã£o pode ser mais intensiva do que em jardins tradicionais, exigindo atenÃ§Ã£o regular Ã  irrigaÃ§Ã£o, fertilizaÃ§Ã£o e controle de pragas. AlÃ©m disso, a escolha de plantas pode ser limitada, jÃ¡ que nem todas as espÃ©cies se adaptam bem ao cultivo vertical.
Outro ponto a considerar Ã© o custo inicial. A instalaÃ§Ã£o de um jardim vertical pode ser cara, especialmente se incluir sistemas de irrigaÃ§Ã£o automatizados e estruturas de suporte robustas. No entanto, com planejamento adequado e escolha de materiais de qualidade, muitos desses desafios podem ser superados, permitindo que vocÃª desfrute dos muitos benefÃ­cios que um jardim vertical pode oferecer.
Como garantir o sucesso do seu jardim vertical?
Para garantir o sucesso do seu jardim vertical, Ã© essencial escolher plantas que se adaptem bem Ã s condiÃ§Ãµes do seu espaÃ§o, considerando fatores como luz e umidade. A instalaÃ§Ã£o de um sistema de irrigaÃ§Ã£o eficiente Ã© crucial para manter as plantas saudÃ¡veis e reduzir o trabalho manual.
AlÃ©m disso, a manutenÃ§Ã£o regular, incluindo poda e monitoramento de pragas, Ã© fundamental para manter o jardim em boas condiÃ§Ãµes. Com dedicaÃ§Ã£o e cuidado, um jardim vertical pode se tornar um elemento vibrante e funcional em qualquer ambiente, trazendo beleza e benefÃ­cios ecolÃ³gicos para o seu espaÃ§o.

author: Fraunhofer IOF
title: Federal President of Germany Frank-Walter Steinmeier Meets International Students of the Abbe School of Photonics in Jena
text:
- Light
Published: | By: Gleb Chupakhin
Source article
Federal President of Germany (in German: BundesprÃ¤sident) Frank-Walter Steinmeier traveled to Jena on February 22nd as part of "Workshop of Change": a series of discussions conducted in cooperation with the BMW Foundation and the Carl Zeiss Foundation. The series highlights successful transformations of economy and society that serve as encouraging examples to the rest of Germany and the world. The BundesprÃ¤sident visited the Fraunhofer Insitute for Applied Optics and Precision Engineering (IOF) as well as Carl Zeiss AG and spoke to students and researchers of the Abbe School of Photonics during his time in Jena.
He praised the city as a site of successful transformation that is contributing to the creation of new opportunities for society, economy, and industry. The BundesprÃ¤sident said that Jena cannot be overlooked in this regard:
Jena is one of those beacons whose shine has managed to reach the whole world.
BundesprÃ¤sident Frank-Walter Steinmeier: Â©
With his visit, he acknowledged Jena's development into an internationally renowned center for optical and optoelectronic research and development. This is partly because Jena has become and remained an open-minded location. Abbe School of Photonics students from many countries conduct research at many companies and research institutions, among them the Fraunhofer Institute. International students, according to the President, are essential to ensuring international connectivity.
Shaping Digital Change and Societal Transformation
Researchers presented the Federal President with new technological approaches to societal challenges and future transformations in modern life and technology during his visit. Jena's optical key players are involved in numerous space missions, particularly those related to Earth observation and climate research. Additionally, work is underway on a mobile 3D hand scanner that aids in the digitization of complex objects such as aircraft engines. State-of-the-art sensor technology, like the system presented, is expected to support digitization in industrial manufacturing in the future.
The visit concluded with a dialogue involving international students of the Abbe School of Photonics and young researchers in the fields of optics and photonics. The conversation underscored the importance of an open-minded culture as the foundation for an excellent and internationally competitive research landscape.
